Planting and caring for Sriracha pepper plants
subtasks: Starting pepper seeds indoors 8-10 weeks before the last frost date.
Planting the seeds in seed trays with warm (70-80 degrees F) environment for germination.
Transplanting seedlings into the garden when outdoor temperatures are consistently above 60 degrees F and the seedlings are strong.
Spacing plants 18-24 inches apart in the garden bed.
Appying mulch around the base of the plants to retain moisture and cool roots.
Watering the plants regularly, keeping soil moist but not waterlogged.
Observing for pest infestations and using neem oil as a control method.
Monitoring companion plants for pest deterrence and adjust plant relationships as needed.
